intro: Calandrinia gayana var. glomerata, commonly known as the clustered bluemink, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often used in rock gardens and as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and attractive blooms. The species is also valued for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
